HomePage.heroTitle: Advanced Online Toolbox for Modern Digital Workflows
HomePage.heroSubtitle: Empowering developers, designers, and creative professionals with innovative digital solutions
HomePage.heroDescription: Discover a comprehensive suite of online tools designed to streamline your work. From advanced unit converters to efficient file format changers and beyond, our platform boosts productivity and creativity.
HomePage.usageInstructions: Use the burger menu in the top-right corner to choose your tools, change the theme, or switch the language between English, German, French, Spanish, Portuguese, Ukrainian, and Chinese.
HomePage.toolsOverviewTitle: Explore Our Diverse Range of Tools
HomePage.toolsOverviewSubtitle: Browse our powerful, cutting-edge tools that simplify complex tasks and elevate your digital workflow.
HomePage.toolCard1Description: Easily convert measurements like length, weight, temperature, and more with high precision.
HomePage.toolCard2Description: Quickly transform files between various formats with just a few clicks.
HomePage.toolCard3Description: Generate secure and random passwords with ease and customizable options.
HomePage.toolCard4Description: Create QR codes for URLs, texts, and more in seconds with our easy-to-use tool.
HomePage.toolCard5Description: Quickly calculate the perfect tip for your bill with our intuitive tip generator.
HomePage.toolCard6Description: Format and validate your JSON data effortlessly to ensure proper syntax and structure.
HomePage.additionalTitle: Innovative Solutions to Transform Your Digital Experience
HomePage.additionalDescription: Our ever-evolving platform provides the latest tools and features designed to maximize your efficiency. Experience unmatched versatility and performance.
HomePage.description: Toolboxes.app is the premier online resource offering a powerful collection of tools to revolutionize your digital workflow.

meter.name: Meter
meter.definition: The meter is the SI base unit of length and serves as the standard measure for distances. It is historically defined and recognized worldwide.

kilometer.name: Kilometer
kilometer.definition: A kilometer equals 1000 meters and is commonly used to indicate distances in practice. It is a common unit in everyday life.

centimeter.name: Centimeter
centimeter.definition: A centimeter is one hundredth of a meter and is often used to measure small lengths. This unit is used in many everyday applications.

millimeter.name: Millimeter
millimeter.definition: A millimeter is one thousandth of a meter and is used for precise measurement of small lengths. This unit is important especially in technical fields.

mile.name: Mile
mile.definition: A mile is a unit of length primarily used in the Anglophone world. It is approximately equal to 1.609 kilometers and has historical significance.

yard.name: Yard
yard.definition: A yard is a unit of length commonly used in the USA and the UK. It is equivalent to 0.9144 meters and is used, among others, in the textile and sports industries.

foot.name: Foot
foot.definition: A foot is a traditional unit of length used in the USA and some other countries. It is equivalent to 0.3048 meters and is mainly used in construction.

inch.name: Inch
inch.definition: An inch is a unit of length used primarily in the Anglophone world. It is equivalent to 2.54 centimeters and is used in technology as well as everyday life.

kilogram.name: Kilogram
kilogram.definition: The kilogram is the SI base unit for mass and serves as the standard measure in science and commerce. It is recognized as a unit of measurement worldwide.

gram.name: Gram
gram.definition: A gram is one thousandth of a kilogram and is frequently used for lighter masses. This unit is especially common in the kitchen and in commerce.

milligram.name: Milligram
milligram.definition: A milligram is one thousandth of a gram and is used to measure very small masses, especially in medicine. It is often used for precise dosage measurements.

pound.name: Pound
pound.definition: The pound is a traditional unit of mass used primarily in the Anglophone world. It is approximately equal to 0.4536 kilograms and is used in commerce and everyday life.

ounce.name: Ounce
ounce.definition: An ounce is a smaller unit of mass known primarily in the Anglophone world. It is approximately 28.35 grams and is often used in the food industry.

square-meter.name: Square Meter
square-meter.definition: The square meter is the unit of area in the International System of Units and is used for measuring areas in architecture and agriculture. It is a standardized and widely used unit.

square-kilometer.name: Square Kilometer
square-kilometer.definition: A square kilometer corresponds to an area of one million square meters. This unit is primarily used to represent large areas, such as land regions.

square-centimeter.name: Square Centimeter
square-centimeter.definition: A square centimeter is a small unit of area, often used in materials science and everyday life. It measures the area of a square with a side length of 1 cm.

square-foot.name: Square Foot
square-foot.definition: A square foot is an area unit used primarily in the USA and the UK, approximately equal to 0.0929 square meters. This unit is often used in real estate.

acre.name: Acre
acre.definition: An acre is a traditional unit of area used primarily in the USA and the UK. It is approximately equal to 4047 square meters and is used in agriculture and real estate appraisal.

cubic-meter.name: Cubic Meter
cubic-meter.definition: The cubic-meter is the unit of volume in the International System of Units and is used to measure space. This unit is important in fields such as construction, storage, and engineering.

cubic-kilometer.name: Cubic Kilometer
cubic-kilometer.definition: A cubic kilometer is a unit of volume equal to one billion cubic meters. It is used to measure large volumes, such as the volume of oceans or reservoirs.

cubic-centimeter.name: Cubic Centimeter
cubic-centimeter.definition: A cubic centimeter is a unit of volume equal to one millionth of a cubic meter. It is commonly used in medicine and engineering for small volume measurements.

cubic-millimeter.name: Cubic Millimeter
cubic-millimeter.definition: A cubic millimeter is a unit of volume equal to one billionth of a cubic meter. It is used for very small volume measurements in scientific and medical applications.

cubic-mile.name: Cubic Mile
cubic-mile.definition: A cubic mile is a unit of volume used primarily in the United States. It is approximately equal to 4.168 cubic kilometers and is used for large-scale volume measurements.

cubic-yard.name: Cubic Yard
cubic-yard.definition: A cubic yard is a unit of volume used in the United States and the United Kingdom. It is approximately equal to 0.7646 cubic meters and is commonly used in construction.

cubic-foot.name: Cubic Foot
cubic-foot.definition: A cubic foot is a unit of volume used in the United States and the United Kingdom. It is approximately equal to 0.0283 cubic meters and is used in various industries.

cubic-inch.name: Cubic Inch
cubic-inch.definition: A cubic inch is a unit of volume used in the United States and the United Kingdom. It is approximately equal to 0.0000164 cubic meters and is used in engineering.

liter.name: Liter
liter.definition: The liter is a unit of volume equal to one cubic decimeter. It is commonly used to measure liquid volumes and is recognized worldwide.

milliliter.name: Milliliter
milliliter.definition: A milliliter is a unit of volume equal to one thousandth of a liter. It is used for small liquid measurements in medicine and cooking.

gallon.name: Gallon
gallon.definition: A gallon is a unit of volume used in the United States and the United Kingdom. It is approximately equal to 3.785 liters and is used for liquid measurements.

celsius.name: Celsius
celsius.definition: The Celsius scale is a temperature unit where 0 °C represents the freezing point of water. It is used worldwide in most countries and is easy to understand.

fahrenheit.name: Fahrenheit
fahrenheit.definition: The Fahrenheit scale is a temperature unit primarily used in the USA. On this scale, the freezing point of water is at 32 °F, distinguishing it from Celsius.

kelvin.name: Kelvin
kelvin.definition: The Kelvin scale is the SI unit for temperature measurements and starts at absolute zero. It is mainly used in science and engineering.

meters-per-second.name: Meters per Second
meters-per-second.definition: Speed in meters per second is an SI unit that indicates how many meters are traveled in one second. It is widely used in physics and engineering.

kilometers-per-hour.name: Kilometers per Hour
kilometers-per-hour.definition: Kilometers per hour indicate how many kilometers are traveled in one hour. This unit is often used in road traffic and meteorology.

miles-per-hour.name: Miles per Hour
miles-per-hour.definition: Miles per hour is a speed unit primarily used in the USA and the UK. It measures how many miles are traveled in one hour.

knot.name: Knot
knot.definition: A knot is a unit of speed used in maritime and aviation contexts. It is equal to one nautical mile per hour, approximately 1.852 kilometers per hour.

second.name: Second
second.definition: The second is the base unit of time in the International System of Units. It is used to measure time intervals and is standardized worldwide.

minute.name: Minute
minute.definition: A minute consists of 60 seconds and is used to measure shorter time periods. This unit is very common in everyday life.

hour.name: Hour
hour.definition: An hour consists of 60 minutes and is a common unit of time for daily use. It is used worldwide and forms the basis of many schedules.

day.name: Day
day.definition: A day corresponds to the Earth's rotation and comprises 24 hours. It is the fundamental unit of time in daily life and is used in almost all cultures.

week.name: Week
week.definition: A week is a unit of time equal to seven days. It is used for organizing schedules and is a common unit in business and personal planning.

month.name: Month
month.definition: A month is a unit of time based on the lunar cycle. It is used for longer-term planning and is a common unit in calendars and financial calculations.

year.name: Year
year.definition: A year is a unit of time based on the Earth's orbit around the Sun. It is used for long-term planning and is a fundamental unit in calendars and historical records.

pascal.name: Pascal
pascal.definition: The pascal is the SI unit for pressure and measures the force per unit area. It is used in physics and engineering to describe pressure conditions.

kilopascal.name: Kilopascal
kilopascal.definition: A kilopascal equals 1000 pascals and is often used to represent pressures in engineering and meteorology. It extends the representation of the pascal to higher values.

bar.name: Bar
bar.definition: The bar is a unit of pressure used primarily in engineering and weather reports. One bar equals 100,000 pascals and is easy to understand.

atmosphere.name: Atmosphere
atmosphere.definition: The atmosphere is a unit of pressure based on the average atmospheric pressure at sea level. It is approximately equal to 101,325 pascals and is used in meteorology.

torr.name: Torr
torr.definition: The torr is a unit of pressure named after Evangelista Torricelli. It is approximately equal to 133.322 pascals and is used in vacuum measurements.

psi.name: Pounds per Square Inch
psi.definition: PSI stands for pounds per square inch and is a pressure unit commonly used in the USA. It measures pressure as force per unit area and is often used in the automotive sector.

joule.name: Joule
joule.definition: The joule is the SI unit for energy and measures the amount of work or heat. It is used in physics, engineering, and chemistry.

kilojoule.name: Kilojoule
kilojoule.definition: A kilojoule equals 1000 joules and is often used in nutrition and engineering. This unit facilitates dealing with larger amounts of energy.

calorie.name: Calorie
calorie.definition: The calorie is a unit of energy often used in nutrition. It measures the amount of energy needed to raise the temperature of water.

kilocalorie.name: Kilocalorie
kilocalorie.definition: The kilocalorie corresponds to 1000 calories and is commonly used to indicate the energy content of foods. It is widely used in nutrition science.

kilowatt-hour.name: Kilowatt Hour
kilowatt-hour.definition: The kilowatt-hour is a unit of energy primarily used for billing electric power. It measures energy consumption over one hour at a power of one kilowatt.

electronvolt.name: Electronvolt
electronvolt.definition: The electronvolt is a unit of energy used in particle physics. It is the amount of energy gained by an electron when it moves through an electric potential difference of one volt.

hartree.name: Hartree
hartree.definition: The hartree is a unit of energy used in atomic physics and quantum chemistry. It is approximately equal to 27.2114 electronvolts.

kilogram-force-meter.name: Kilogram Force Meter
kilogram-force-meter.definition: The kilogram-force meter is a unit of energy representing the work done by a force of one kilogram-force acting through a distance of one meter.

kilopond-meter.name: Kilopond Meter
kilopond-meter.definition: The kilopond meter is a unit of energy equal to the work done by a force of one kilopond acting through a distance of one meter.

gram-force-meter.name: Gram Force Meter
gram-force-meter.definition: The gram-force meter is a unit of energy representing the work done by a force of one gram-force acting through a distance of one meter.

pound-force-foot.name: Pound Force Foot
pound-force-foot.definition: The pound-force foot is a unit of energy representing the work done by a force of one pound-force acting through a distance of one foot.

pound-force-inch.name: Pound Force Inch
pound-force-inch.definition: The pound-force inch is a unit of energy representing the work done by a force of one pound-force acting through a distance of one inch.

ounce-force-foot.name: Ounce Force Foot
ounce-force-foot.definition: The ounce-force foot is a unit of energy representing the work done by a force of one ounce-force acting through a distance of one foot.

ounce-force-inch.name: Ounce Force Inch
ounce-force-inch.definition: The ounce-force inch is a unit of energy representing the work done by a force of one ounce-force acting through a distance of one inch.

ton-force-foot.name: Ton Force Foot
ton-force-foot.definition: The ton-force foot is a unit of energy representing the work done by a force of one ton-force acting through a distance of one foot.

ton-force-inch.name: Ton Force Inch
ton-force-inch.definition: The ton-force inch is a unit of energy representing the work done by a force of one ton-force acting through a distance of one inch.

poundal-foot.name: Poundal Foot
poundal-foot.definition: The poundal foot is a unit of energy representing the work done by a force of one poundal acting through a distance of one foot.

poundal-inch.name: Poundal Inch
poundal-inch.definition: The poundal inch is a unit of energy representing the work done by a force of one poundal acting through a distance of one inch.

ounceal-foot.name: Ounceal Foot
ounceal-foot.definition: The ounceal foot is a unit of energy representing the work done by a force of one ounceal acting through a distance of one foot.

ounceal-inch.name: Ounceal Inch
ounceal-inch.definition: The ounceal inch is a unit of energy representing the work done by a force of one ounceal acting through a distance of one inch.

tonal-foot.name: Tonal Foot
tonal-foot.definition: The tonal foot is a unit of energy representing the work done by a force of one tonal acting through a distance of one foot.

tonal-inch.name: Tonal Inch
tonal-inch.definition: The tonal inch is a unit of energy representing the work done by a force of one tonal acting through a distance of one inch.

watt.name: Watt
watt.definition: The watt is the SI unit of power and measures the amount of energy transferred per unit time. It is used in electrical engineering and physics.

kilowatt.name: Kilowatt
kilowatt.definition: A kilowatt equals 1000 watts and is often used to indicate the power of devices and engines. This unit is widely used in the energy industry and engineering.

horsepower.name: Horsepower
horsepower.definition: Horsepower is a unit of power historically used to describe the power of machines. It indicates how much power is required to perform a certain amount of work and is often used in the automotive industry.

british-thermal-unit-per-hour.name: British Thermal Unit per Hour
british-thermal-unit-per-hour.definition: The British thermal unit per hour is a unit of power used primarily in the United States. It measures the rate of energy transfer and is common in heating and cooling systems.

calorie-per-second.name: Calorie per Second
calorie-per-second.definition: Calories per second is a unit of power measuring the rate of energy transfer. It is used in thermal engineering and nutrition science.

kilocalorie-per-second.name: Kilocalorie per Second
kilocalorie-per-second.definition: Kilocalories per second is a unit of power measuring the rate of energy transfer. It is used in thermal engineering and large-scale energy calculations.

watt-per-square-meter.name: Watt per Square Meter
watt-per-square-meter.definition: Watts per square meter is a unit of power density measuring the rate of energy transfer per unit area. It is used in solar radiation and heat transfer calculations.

kilowatt-per-square-meter.name: Kilowatt per Square Meter
kilowatt-per-square-meter.definition: Kilowatts per square meter is a unit of power density measuring the rate of energy transfer per unit area. It is used in large-scale energy calculations.

horsepower-per-square-meter.name: Horsepower per Square Meter
horsepower-per-square-meter.definition: Horsepower per square meter is a unit of power density measuring the rate of energy transfer per unit area. It is used in engineering applications.

british-thermal-unit-per-hour-per-square.name: British Thermal Unit per Hour per Square Foot
british-thermal-unit-per-hour-per-square.definition: British thermal units per hour per square foot is a unit of power density used in the United States. It measures the rate of energy transfer per unit area.

calorie-per-second-per-square-meter.name: Calorie per Second per Square Meter
calorie-per-second-per-square-meter.definition: Calories per second per square meter is a unit of power density measuring the rate of energy transfer per unit area. It is used in thermal engineering.

kilocalorie-per-second-per-square-meter.name: Kilocalorie per Second per Square Meter
kilocalorie-per-second-per-square-meter.definition: Kilocalories per second per square meter is a unit of power density measuring the rate of energy transfer per unit area. It is used in large-scale thermal engineering.

watt-per-square-meter-kelvin.name: Watt per Square Meter Kelvin
watt-per-square-meter-kelvin.definition: Watts per square meter kelvin is a unit of heat transfer coefficient. It measures the rate of heat transfer per unit area per unit temperature difference.

kilowatt-per-square-meter-kelvin.name: Kilowatt per Square Meter Kelvin
kilowatt-per-square-meter-kelvin.definition: Kilowatts per square meter kelvin is a unit of heat transfer coefficient. It measures the rate of heat transfer per unit area per unit temperature difference.

horsepower-per-square-meter-kelvin.name: Horsepower per Square Meter Kelvin
horsepower-per-square-meter-kelvin.definition: Horsepower per square meter kelvin is a unit of heat transfer coefficient. It measures the rate of heat transfer per unit area per unit temperature difference.

british-thermal-unit-per-hour-per-square.name: British Thermal Unit per Hour per Square Foot Kelvin
british-thermal-unit-per-hour-per-square.definition: British thermal units per hour per square foot kelvin is a unit of heat transfer coefficient used in the United States. It measures the rate of heat transfer per unit area per unit temperature difference.

calorie-per-second-per-square-meter-kelv.name: Calorie per Second per Square Meter Kelvin
calorie-per-second-per-square-meter-kelv.definition: Calories per second per square meter kelvin is a unit of heat transfer coefficient. It measures the rate of heat transfer per unit area per unit temperature difference.

kilocalorie-per-second-per-square-meter-.name: Kilocalorie per Second per Square Meter Kelvin
kilocalorie-per-second-per-square-meter-.definition: Kilocalories per second per square meter kelvin is a unit of heat transfer coefficient. It measures the rate of heat transfer per unit area per unit temperature difference.

byte.name: Byte
byte.definition: A byte is the basic unit of digital information, typically consisting of 8 bits. It forms the basis of data storage in computers.

kilobyte.name: Kilobyte
kilobyte.definition: A kilobyte equals 1024 bytes and is used to measure the size of small files. This unit is common in computer science.

megabyte.name: Megabyte
megabyte.definition: A megabyte equals 1024 kilobytes and is often used to describe file size or storage capacity. This unit is common in the digital world.

gigabyte.name: Gigabyte
gigabyte.definition: A gigabyte equals 1024 megabytes and is used to measure the storage capacity of hard drives and other devices. This unit is common in information technology.

terabyte.name: Terabyte
terabyte.definition: A terabyte equals 1024 gigabytes and is used to measure large storage capacities. This unit is common in data centers and large-scale storage systems.

petabyte.name: Petabyte
petabyte.definition: A petabyte equals 1024 terabytes and is used to measure very large storage capacities. This unit is common in big data and cloud storage systems.

exabyte.name: Exabyte
exabyte.definition: An exabyte equals 1024 petabytes and is used to measure extremely large storage capacities. This unit is common in global data storage calculations.

zettabyte.name: Zettabyte
zettabyte.definition: A zettabyte equals 1024 exabytes and is used to measure massive storage capacities. This unit is used in global data volume calculations.

yottabyte.name: Yottabyte
yottabyte.definition: A yottabyte equals 1024 zettabytes and is used to measure the largest storage capacities. This unit is used in theoretical data volume calculations.

degree.name: Degree
degree.definition: The degree is a common unit for angles, with a full circle consisting of 360 degrees. It is frequently used in geometry and everyday life.

radian.name: Radian
radian.definition: The radian is the SI unit for measuring angles and describes the angle as the arc length relative to the radius of a circle. It is fundamental in mathematics and physics.

gradian.name: Gradian
gradian.definition: The gradian is an alternative unit for measuring angles, where a right angle is equal to 100 gradians. It is used in certain technical fields and provides a decimal-based representation.

minute.name: Minute of Arc
minute.definition: A minute of arc is one sixtieth of a degree. It is used for precise angle measurements in astronomy and navigation.

second.name: Second of Arc
second.definition: A second of arc is one sixtieth of a minute of arc. It is used for very precise angle measurements in astronomy and geodesy.

milliradian.name: Milliradian
milliradian.definition: A milliradian is one thousandth of a radian. It is used in military and engineering applications for precise angle measurements.

milligradian.name: Milligradian
milligradian.definition: A milligradian is one thousandth of a gradian. It is used in surveying and engineering for precise angle measurements.

milliarc-second.name: Milliarc Second
milliarc-second.definition: A milliarc second is one thousandth of an arc second. It is used in astronomy for very precise angle measurements.

microarc-second.name: Microarc Second
microarc-second.definition: A microarc second is one millionth of an arc second. It is used in astronomy for extremely precise angle measurements.

microarc-minute.name: Microarc Minute
microarc-minute.definition: A microarc minute is one millionth of an arc minute. It is used in astronomy for very precise angle measurements.

hertz.name: Hertz
hertz.definition: The hertz is the SI unit for frequency and indicates how many oscillations occur per second. It is widely used in physics and engineering.

kilohertz.name: Kilohertz
kilohertz.definition: A kilohertz equals 1000 hertz and is frequently used to describe audio frequencies and in communication technology. This unit is common in electronics.

megahertz.name: Megahertz
megahertz.definition: A megahertz equals 1,000,000 hertz and is often used in radio technology and frequency measurements. It is significant in communication and electronics.

gigahertz.name: Gigahertz
gigahertz.definition: A gigahertz equals 1,000,000,000 hertz and is primarily used in describing processor and radio frequencies. This unit is indispensable in modern technology.

terahertz.name: Terahertz
terahertz.definition: A terahertz equals 1,000,000,000,000 hertz and is used in advanced scientific research and technology. This unit is significant in spectroscopy and imaging.

petahertz.name: Petahertz
petahertz.definition: A petahertz equals 1,000,000,000,000,000 hertz and is used in cutting-edge scientific research. This unit is significant in quantum physics and advanced spectroscopy.

exahertz.name: Exahertz
exahertz.definition: An exahertz equals 1,000,000,000,000,000,000 hertz and is used in theoretical physics and advanced scientific research. This unit is significant in quantum mechanics.

zettahertz.name: Zettahertz
zettahertz.definition: A zettahertz equals 1,000,000,000,000,000,000,000 hertz and is used in theoretical physics. This unit is significant in advanced scientific research.

yottahertz.name: Yottahertz
yottahertz.definition: A yottahertz equals 1,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000 hertz and is used in theoretical physics. This unit is significant in advanced scientific research.

newton.name: Newton
newton.definition: The newton is the SI unit for force and is defined as the force needed to accelerate a 1-kilogram mass at 1 m/s². This unit is fundamental in physics.

kilonewton.name: Kilonewton
kilonewton.definition: A kilonewton equals 1000 newtons and is frequently used in engineering and construction to measure larger forces. It provides a more convenient representation of high force values.

meganewton.name: Meganewton
meganewton.definition: A meganewton equals 1,000,000 newtons and is used to measure very large forces. This unit is common in structural engineering and aerospace.

giganewton.name: Giganewton
giganewton.definition: A giganewton equals 1,000,000,000 newtons and is used to measure extremely large forces. This unit is used in theoretical physics and engineering.

teranewton.name: Teranewton
teranewton.definition: A teranewton equals 1,000,000,000,000 newtons and is used to measure massive forces. This unit is used in theoretical physics and engineering.

petanewton.name: Petanewton
petanewton.definition: A petanewton equals 1,000,000,000,000,000 newtons and is used to measure extremely large forces. This unit is used in theoretical physics.

exanewton.name: Exanewton
exanewton.definition: An exanewton equals 1,000,000,000,000,000,000 newtons and is used to measure massive forces. This unit is used in theoretical physics.

zettahertz.name: Zettanewton
zettahertz.definition: A zettanewton equals 1,000,000,000,000,000,000,000 newtons and is used to measure extremely large forces. This unit is used in theoretical physics.

yottahertz.name: Yottanewton
yottahertz.definition: A yottanewton equals 1,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000 newtons and is used to measure massive forces. This unit is used in theoretical physics.

dyne.name: Dyne
dyne.definition: The dyne is a unit of force in the centimeter-gram-second system. It is equal to 10⁻⁵ newtons and is used in physics and engineering.

kilogram-force.name: Kilogram Force
kilogram-force.definition: The kilogram-force is a unit of force equal to the force exerted by one kilogram of mass in standard gravity. It is used in engineering and physics.

kilopond.name: Kilopond
kilopond.definition: The kilopond is a unit of force equal to the force exerted by one kilogram of mass in standard gravity. It is used in engineering and physics.

gram-force.name: Gram Force
gram-force.definition: The gram-force is a unit of force equal to the force exerted by one gram of mass in standard gravity. It is used in engineering and physics.

pound-force.name: Pound Force
pound-force.definition: Pound-force is a unit of force used primarily in the Anglophone world that indicates the force resulting from the weight of one pound. This unit is often used in engineering.

ounce-force.name: Ounce Force
ounce-force.definition: The ounce-force is a unit of force equal to the force exerted by one ounce of mass in standard gravity. It is used in engineering and physics.

ton-force.name: Ton Force
ton-force.definition: The ton-force is a unit of force equal to the force exerted by one ton of mass in standard gravity. It is used in engineering and physics.

poundal.name: Poundal
poundal.definition: The poundal is a unit of force in the foot-pound-second system. It is equal to 0.138255 newtons and is used in physics and engineering.

ounceal.name: Ounceal
ounceal.definition: The ounceal is a unit of force in the foot-pound-second system. It is equal to 0.008640 newtons and is used in physics and engineering.

tonal.name: Tonal
tonal.definition: The tonal is a unit of force in the foot-pound-second system. It is equal to 2000 poundals and is used in physics and engineering.

kilogram-per-cubic-meter.name: Kilogram per Cubic Meter
kilogram-per-cubic-meter.definition: Density in kilograms per cubic-meter is an SI unit that indicates mass per unit volume. It is used to characterize the properties of materials.

gram-per-cubic-centimeter.name: Gram per Cubic Centimeter
gram-per-cubic-centimeter.definition: Density in grams per cubic-centimeter is often used in materials science to determine the mass in a given volume. This unit allows comparison of material densities.

kilogram-per-cubic-centimeter.name: Kilogram per Cubic Centimeter
kilogram-per-cubic-centimeter.definition: Density in kilograms per cubic centimeter is used to measure very dense materials. This unit is common in materials science and engineering.

gram-per-cubic-meter.name: Gram per Cubic Meter
gram-per-cubic-meter.definition: Density in grams per cubic meter is used to measure very low density materials. This unit is common in environmental science.

kilogram-per-cubic-kilometer.name: Kilogram per Cubic Kilometer
kilogram-per-cubic-kilometer.definition: Density in kilograms per cubic kilometer is used to measure extremely low density materials. This unit is used in scientific research.

gram-per-cubic-kilometer.name: Gram per Cubic Kilometer
gram-per-cubic-kilometer.definition: Density in grams per cubic kilometer is used to measure extremely low density materials. This unit is used in scientific research.

kilogram-per-cubic-millimeter.name: Kilogram per Cubic Millimeter
kilogram-per-cubic-millimeter.definition: Density in kilograms per cubic millimeter is used to measure very dense materials. This unit is common in materials science.

gram-per-cubic-millimeter.name: Gram per Cubic Millimeter
gram-per-cubic-millimeter.definition: Density in grams per cubic millimeter is used to measure very dense materials. This unit is common in materials science.

kilogram-per-cubic-mile.name: Kilogram per Cubic Mile
kilogram-per-cubic-mile.definition: Density in kilograms per cubic mile is used to measure materials in large volumes. This unit is used in environmental science.

gram-per-cubic-mile.name: Gram per Cubic Mile
gram-per-cubic-mile.definition: Density in grams per cubic mile is used to measure materials in large volumes. This unit is used in environmental science.

kilogram-per-cubic-yard.name: Kilogram per Cubic Yard
kilogram-per-cubic-yard.definition: Density in kilograms per cubic yard is used to measure materials in construction. This unit is common in the United States.

gram-per-cubic-yard.name: Gram per Cubic Yard
gram-per-cubic-yard.definition: Density in grams per cubic yard is used to measure materials in construction. This unit is common in the United States.

kilogram-per-cubic-foot.name: Kilogram per Cubic Foot
kilogram-per-cubic-foot.definition: Density in kilograms per cubic foot is used to measure materials in construction. This unit is common in the United States.

gram-per-cubic-foot.name: Gram per Cubic Foot
gram-per-cubic-foot.definition: Density in grams per cubic foot is used to measure materials in construction. This unit is common in the United States.

kilogram-per-cubic-inch.name: Kilogram per Cubic Inch
kilogram-per-cubic-inch.definition: Density in kilograms per cubic inch is used to measure materials in construction. This unit is common in the United States.

gram-per-cubic-inch.name: Gram per Cubic Inch
gram-per-cubic-inch.definition: Density in grams per cubic inch is used to measure materials in construction. This unit is common in the United States.

pound-per-cubic-foot.name: Pound per Cubic Foot
pound-per-cubic-foot.definition: Density in pounds per cubic foot is a unit commonly used in the Anglophone world. It measures mass per unit volume and is frequently used in construction and materials engineering.

cubic-meters-per-second.name: Cubic Meters per Second
cubic-meters-per-second.definition: The volume flow in cubic-meters per second measures the amount of a fluid flowing through a cross-section per second. This unit is important in fluid dynamics.

cubic-kilometer-per-second.name: Cubic Kilometer per Second
cubic-kilometer-per-second.definition: The volume flow in cubic kilometers per second measures the amount of a fluid flowing through a cross-section per second. This unit is used in large-scale fluid dynamics.

cubic-centimeter-per-second.name: Cubic Centimeter per Second
cubic-centimeter-per-second.definition: The volume flow in cubic centimeters per second measures the amount of a fluid flowing through a cross-section per second. This unit is used in small-scale fluid dynamics.

cubic-millimeter-per-second.name: Cubic Millimeter per Second
cubic-millimeter-per-second.definition: The volume flow in cubic millimeters per second measures the amount of a fluid flowing through a cross-section per second. This unit is used in very small-scale fluid dynamics.

cubic-mile-per-second.name: Cubic Mile per Second
cubic-mile-per-second.definition: The volume flow in cubic miles per second measures the amount of a fluid flowing through a cross-section per second. This unit is used in large-scale fluid dynamics.

cubic-yard-per-second.name: Cubic Yard per Second
cubic-yard-per-second.definition: The volume flow in cubic yards per second measures the amount of a fluid flowing through a cross-section per second. This unit is used in construction and engineering.

cubic-foot-per-second.name: Cubic Foot per Second
cubic-foot-per-second.definition: The volume flow in cubic feet per second measures the amount of a fluid flowing through a cross-section per second. This unit is used in construction and engineering.

cubic-inch-per-second.name: Cubic Inch per Second
cubic-inch-per-second.definition: The volume flow in cubic inches per second measures the amount of a fluid flowing through a cross-section per second. This unit is used in construction and engineering.

cubic-kilometer-per-hour.name: Cubic Kilometer per Hour
cubic-kilometer-per-hour.definition: The volume flow in cubic kilometers per hour measures the amount of a fluid flowing through a cross-section per hour. This unit is used in large-scale fluid dynamics.

cubic-centimeter-per-hour.name: Cubic Centimeter per Hour
cubic-centimeter-per-hour.definition: The volume flow in cubic centimeters per hour measures the amount of a fluid flowing through a cross-section per hour. This unit is used in small-scale fluid dynamics.

cubic-millimeter-per-hour.name: Cubic Millimeter per Hour
cubic-millimeter-per-hour.definition: The volume flow in cubic millimeters per hour measures the amount of a fluid flowing through a cross-section per hour. This unit is used in very small-scale fluid dynamics.

cubic-mile-per-hour.name: Cubic Mile per Hour
cubic-mile-per-hour.definition: The volume flow in cubic miles per hour measures the amount of a fluid flowing through a cross-section per hour. This unit is used in large-scale fluid dynamics.

cubic-yard-per-hour.name: Cubic Yard per Hour
cubic-yard-per-hour.definition: The volume flow in cubic yards per hour measures the amount of a fluid flowing through a cross-section per hour. This unit is used in construction and engineering.

cubic-foot-per-hour.name: Cubic Foot per Hour
cubic-foot-per-hour.definition: The volume flow in cubic feet per hour measures the amount of a fluid flowing through a cross-section per hour. This unit is used in construction and engineering.

cubic-inch-per-hour.name: Cubic Inch per Hour
cubic-inch-per-hour.definition: The volume flow in cubic inches per hour measures the amount of a fluid flowing through a cross-section per hour. This unit is used in construction and engineering.

liters-per-second.name: Liters per Second
liters-per-second.definition: The volume flow in liters per second indicates how many liters of a fluid flow per second. This unit is frequently used in process engineering.

gallons-per-minute.name: Gallons per Minute
gallons-per-minute.definition: The volume flow in gallons per minute measures the amount of a fluid flowing per minute. This unit is common in the USA and used in technical applications.

kilogram-per-square-meter.definition: Area density in kilograms per square meter indicates how much mass is distributed over a given area. It is used primarily in construction and materials science.

gram-per-square-centimeter.definition: Area density in grams per square centimeter measures the mass per unit area and is used in engineering. This unit enables precise calculations for small areas.

lux.name: Lux
lux.definition: The lux is the SI unit for illuminance and measures how much light falls on a surface per square meter. It is significant in lighting technology and architecture.

foot-candle.name: Foot Candle
foot-candle.definition: A foot-candle is a unit of illuminance used primarily in the Anglophone world that indicates how much light falls on one square foot. This unit is often used in lighting design.

lumen-per-square-meter.name: Lumen per Square Meter
lumen-per-square-meter.definition: Lumens per square meter is a unit of illuminance measuring the luminous flux per unit area. It is used in lighting design and engineering.

lumen-per-square-centimeter.name: Lumen per Square Centimeter
lumen-per-square-centimeter.definition: Lumens per square centimeter is a unit of illuminance measuring the luminous flux per unit area. It is used in lighting design and engineering.

lumen-per-square-millimeter.name: Lumen per Square Millimeter
lumen-per-square-millimeter.definition: Lumens per square millimeter is a unit of illuminance measuring the luminous flux per unit area. It is used in lighting design and engineering.

lumen-per-square-foot.name: Lumen per Square Foot
lumen-per-square-foot.definition: Lumens per square foot is a unit of illuminance measuring the luminous flux per unit area. It is used in lighting design and engineering.

lumen-per-square-inch.name: Lumen per Square Inch
lumen-per-square-inch.definition: Lumens per square inch is a unit of illuminance measuring the luminous flux per unit area. It is used in lighting design and engineering.

lumen-per-square-yard.name: Lumen per Square Yard
lumen-per-square-yard.definition: Lumens per square yard is a unit of illuminance measuring the luminous flux per unit area. It is used in lighting design and engineering.

bits-per-second.name: Bits per Second
bits-per-second.definition: Bits per second is the unit for data transfer rate and indicates how many bits are transmitted in one second. This unit is central in information technology.

kilobits-per-second.name: Kilobits per Second
kilobits-per-second.definition: Kilobits per second equals 1000 bits per second and is frequently used in network communications. This unit helps determine internet speeds.

megabits-per-second.name: Megabits per Second
megabits-per-second.definition: Megabits per second equals 1,000,000 bits per second and is often used to indicate internet and data transfer speeds. It is common in telecommunications.

gigabits-per-second.name: Gigabits per Second
gigabits-per-second.definition: Gigabits per second equals 1,000,000,000 bits per second and is primarily used in high-speed networks. This unit is indispensable for modern data communication systems.

terabits-per-second.name: Terabits per Second
terabits-per-second.definition: Terabits per second equals 1,000,000,000,000 bits per second and is used in high-speed networks. This unit is significant in modern data communication systems.

petabits-per-second.name: Petabits per Second
petabits-per-second.definition: Petabits per second equals 1,000,000,000,000,000 bits per second and is used in high-speed networks. This unit is significant in modern data communication systems.

exabits-per-second.name: Exabits per Second
exabits-per-second.definition: Exabits per second equals 1,000,000,000,000,000,000 bits per second and is used in high-speed networks. This unit is significant in modern data communication systems.

zettabits-per-second.name: Zettabits per Second
zettabits-per-second.definition: Zettabits per second equals 1,000,000,000,000,000,000,000 bits per second and is used in high-speed networks. This unit is significant in modern data communication systems.

yottabits-per-second.name: Yottabits per Second
yottabits-per-second.definition: Yottabits per second equals 1,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000 bits per second and is used in high-speed networks. This unit is significant in modern data communication systems.

bytes-per-second.name: Bytes per Second
bytes-per-second.definition: Bytes per second measures the data transfer rate in bytes and is used to determine the speed of data transfers. This unit is relevant in computer technology.

kilobytes-per-second.name: Kilobytes per Second
kilobytes-per-second.definition: Kilobytes per second equals 1024 bytes per second and is often used to measure download and upload speeds. This unit is common in computer science.

megabytes-per-second.name: Megabytes per Second
megabytes-per-second.definition: Megabytes per second equals 1024 kilobytes per second and is used to indicate data transfer rates in computers and networks. This unit is common in digital data transfer.
